title: TIDMAD
description: Improving dark matter detection at MIT's ABRACADABRA experiment by enhancing denoising algorithms, developing machine learning models for signal processing, and collaborating with physicists to interpret results.

title: NYC Vehicle Crash Analysis
description: Conducted independent research on NYC vehicle crash data, identifying bias and predicting risk in school zones using KD-Trees and Random Forest. Presented findings with ethical considerations through data storytelling.

title: DSC 106 Project 1
description: Investigated summer and winter rainfall variations across major US cities. Created a data visualization comparing average rainfall for summer and winter, revealing Miami's unusual high amount of summer rainfall.

title: DSC 106 Lab 4
description: A DSC 106 assignment that goes more in depth with Javascript.

title: DSC 106 Lab 1
description: Created this website for the first time.

title: DataScientist.AI
description: Created DataScientist.AI, an AI-powered platform for streamlined data science workflows. Built a context-aware pipeline for automated data analysis, including quality checks, statistics, feature engineering, and bias detection. Implemented advanced machine learning with features like model selection, hyperparameter tuning, and performance evaluation. Designed interactive visualizations for clear communication of insights. Engineered the full-stack solution using Python, Streamlit, and Google's Gemini AI, integrating cutting-edge LLM capabilities.

title: DSC 80 Food Analysis
description: Predicting cooking times using Food.com data to uncover relationships between preparation time, nutrition, and user ratings.

title: Cruz Roja Tijuana
description: Improved ambulance allocation website for Tijuana by streamlining data tables, resolving duplication issues, and enhancing accessibility for faster emergency response.

title: PlanetFlip
description: Developed an interactive game to educate users on the environmental impact of commuting, using Figma wireframes and collaborating with a non-profit to create an engaging, visually rich learning experience.

title: Franklin Research
description: Performed a detailed analysis on a diabetes dataset, benchmarking 8 ML algorithms to identify the best model for diagnosis and ranking risk factors based on their impact, all implemented in Python on Google Colab.
